thread.title: 20 best wild places for culture in Britain
thread.title_full: 20 best wild places for culture in Britain

title: 20 best wild places for culture in Britain
text:
Times critics Published 1 minute ago Iron Age artworks, jazz in the woods and a theatre on a cliff — Times critics pick the wildest spots for the arts in the UK 
1. A tropical paradise , Penzance The Tremenheere Sculpture Garden was founded barely three years ago in a sheltered West Cornish valley with amazing views to the wild crags of the coast. Discover a James Turrell skyscape among the palm trees or a camera obscura amid exotic succulents. Details Gulval, Penzance ( tremenheere.co.uk ), all summer 
2. Cliffhanger theatre , Cornwall Normally it’s bad form for a backdrop to upstage the play. Yet when you sit on the stone steps at the Minack Theatre, a spectacular granite amphitheatre perched on the edge of a cliff near Land’s End, you’re gazing out at the Subscribe now
